string.text: You can manage your workshop ({WORKSHOPNAME}) here. Expected profit: {PROFIT}
You need to rent a warehouse to change these.
If you stop renting warehouse, every item in it will be sold to town. Are you sure?
You can upgrade your workshop in various ways to increase profit. Currently you have: {UPGRADES}
Buying this upgrade will cost {UP_COST}. Are you sure?
You do not have enough gold to pay upgrade cost ({UP_COST}).
Upgrade will be removed from workshop. Are you sure?

Add a building extension to your workshop. This will cost {UP_COST}. Extension will let your workers be more efficient, resulting in higher production speed ({UPGRADE_VALUE}%). Be aware though higher production will cause higher consumption of materials and providing more products to the market. This will likely affect prices.

Buy extra tools for your workers. This will cost {UP_COST}. Extra tools will improve production process, resulting in higher amount of product from same amount of materials ({UPGRADE_VALUE}%). Note that if the bonus is not a whole number, it will be saved until it can be used to produce an extra product.

Buy a market stall for your products. This will cost {UP_COST}. Market stall will give you a chance ({UPGRADE_VALUE}%) to sell your products directly to townsfolk instead of town market. Selling directly to townsfolk will decrease supply and help with keeping prices higher. Note that the chance of selling to townsfolk is calculated separately for every product.
Provide better furniture for your workers. This will cost {UP_COST}. Providing better furniture will increase happiness of your workers, resulting in lower wages ({UPGRADE_VALUE}%).
Additional workshop count at the start of the game. Added to the base value.
Additional workshop count per clan tier. Added to the base value.
Production speed multiplier for workshops. Use this if you want to adjust profitability.
Wage multiplier for all workforce levels and base value. Use this if you want to adjust profitability.
Price multiplier for workshops for player.
Ignores non-trade when not selling to market. Recommended for a balanced game.
Multiplier for Trade skill XP gained per daily profit from workshops.
Workshop is supplied money from player when capital is under this value to prevent bankruptcy.
Prevents player losing the workshop if war is declared. The workshop will stop working instead
Minimum rent to be paid if the rented warehouse is empty.
Maximum rent to be paid if the rented warehouse is above the weight threshold.
You will pay maximum rent if total weight is above this.
Maximum caravan budget to be spent on buying workshop outputs when they enter the settlement.
Percentage of price your caravans will need to pay to your workshops.
Additional amount to be bought from market when input stock is under threshold. Requires warehouse.
Input stock threshold to determine when to buy extra from market.
Additional amount to be sold from warehouse when price is determined to be good. Requires warehouse.
Amount To Be Sold On Market Change
Amount to be sold when market change is detected and price is determined to be good. Requires warehouse.
Target minimum output stock value where selling price percentage starts dropping.
Target maximum output stock value where selling price percentage is the minimum given.
Output items will not be sold at any price percentage under this regardless of stock.
Output items will be sold at any price percentage above this regardless of stock.
